item.title: Hugo
item.description: I’m switching to Hugo! Things are going mostly smooth so far. Here’s a story of mistakes I made while getting things set up. Prologue: Installing Hugo So I open up the Hugo installation page, Ctrl-f-ed for “Ubuntu”, saw that it was available via apt, and installed it. Everything goes smoothly, and migrating my (very little) content was super easy. Awesome! No problem! (Narrator: …or so she thought.) Chapter 1: Deploying to GitHub Pages I was previously using Jekyll, whose developer, Tom Preston-Warner, was a founder of GitHub.
